009package imagingbook.common.color.colorspace;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.color.cie.StandardIlluminant.D50;
012
013import java.awt.color.ColorSpace;
014
015import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.BradfordAdaptation;
016import imagingbook.common.color.adapt.ChromaticAdaptation;
017import imagingbook.common.color.cie.CieUtils;
018import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
019//import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
020
021/**
022 * A color space specified by its RGB primaries and white point coordinates, all defined
023 * in two-dimensional CIE xy-space. The associated 3D XYZ coordinates are calculated from
024 * the 2D coordinates. This guarantees that all associated XYZ coordinates are consistent.
025 * Note that there is a substantial variation in published XYZ data. This setup relies
026 * on xy color coordinates only, and consistent XYZ coordinates are obtained by solving
027 * a system of linear equations to recover the unknown Yr, Yg, and Yb coordinates.
028 *
029 */
030@SuppressWarnings("serial")
031public abstract class AbstractRgbColorSpace extends ColorSpace {
032
033        private static final ColorSpace CS_sRGB = ColorSpace.getInstance(ColorSpace.CS_sRGB);
034
035    private final double[] XYZw;      // XYZ coordinates of white point
036    /** The 3x3 matrix for converting (normalized) RGB to XYZ coordinates. */
037    protected final double[][] Mrgb;
038    /** The 3x3 matrix for converting XYZ to (normalized) RGB coordinates. Inverse of {@link #Mrgb}. */
039    protected final double[][] Mrgbi;
040    /** Chromatic adaptation instance for converting colors from this color space's white point to D50. */
041    protected final ChromaticAdaptation catWtoD50; // = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D65, D50);
042    /** Chromatic adaptation instance for converting colors from D50 to this color space's white point. */
043    protected final ChromaticAdaptation catD50toW; // = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50, D65);
044
045    /**
046     * Constructor, builds a {@link AbstractRgbColorSpace} from CIE xy-coordinates of tristimulus values and white point.
047     * @param xr x-coordinate of primary R
048     * @param yr y-coordinate of primary R
049     * @param xg x-coordinate of primary G
050     * @param yg y-coordinate of primary G
051     * @param xb x-coordinate of primary B
052     * @param yb y-coordinate of primary B
053     * @param xw x-coordinate of white point
054     * @param yw y-coordinate of white point
055     */
056    protected AbstractRgbColorSpace(double xr, double yr, double xg, double yg, double xb, double yb, double xw, double yw) {
057        super(ColorSpace.TYPE_RGB, 3);
058        this.XYZw = CieUtils.xyYToXYZ(xw, yw, 1);
059
060        this.catWtoD50 = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(XYZw, D50.getXYZ());
061        this.catD50toW = BradfordAdaptation.getInstance(D50.getXYZ(), XYZw);
062
063        double[][] M =
064               {{xr / yr, xg / yg, xb / yb},
065                {1, 1, 1},
066                {(1 - xr - yr) / yr, (1 - xg - yg) / yg, (1 - xb - yb) / yb }};
067        double[] YYY = Matrix.solve(M, XYZw);   // determine {Yr, Yg, Yb}
068
069        // RGB primaries in XYZ
070        double[] XYZr = CieUtils.xyYToXYZ(xr, yr, YYY[0]);
071        double[] XYZg = CieUtils.xyYToXYZ(xg, yg, YYY[1]);
072        double[] XYZb = CieUtils.xyYToXYZ(xb, yb, YYY[2]);
073
074        this.Mrgbi = Matrix.transpose(new double[][] {XYZr, XYZg, XYZb});
075        this.Mrgb  = Matrix.inverse(Mrgbi);
076    }
077
078    /**
079         * Returns the XYZ coordinates of the white point associated with this color space (typically D65 or D50).
080         *
081         * @return the white point
082         */
083    public float[] getWhitePoint() {
084        return Matrix.toFloat(XYZw);
085    }
086
087    /**
088         * Returns the XYZ color coordinates for the primary color with the specified index, measured relative to the white
089         * point of this color space (see {@link #getWhitePoint()}).
090         *
091         * @param idx the color index (R = 0, G = 1, B = 2)
092         * @return the XYZ coordinate for the primary color
093         */
094    public float[] getPrimary(int idx) {
095        return Matrix.toFloat(Matrix.getColumn(Mrgbi, idx));
096    }
097
098    /**
099     * Returns the 3x3 matrix for converting from CIE-XYZ color space to linear RGB.
100     * Its column vectors are the XYZ coordinates of the RGB primaries.
101     * @return a 3x3 matrix
102     * @see #getMrgb()
103     */
104    public double[][] getMrgbi() {
105        return this.Mrgbi;
106    }
107
108    /**
109     * Returns the 3x3 matrix for converting from linear RGB to CIE-XYZ color space.
110     * @return a 3x3 matrix
111     * @see #getMrgbi()
112     */
113    public double[][] getMrgb() {
114        return this.Mrgb;
115    }
116
117    // -----------------------------------------------------------
118
119    @Override   // convert from sRGB to a color in this space (via XYZ50)
120    public float[] fromRGB(float[] srgb) {
121        float[] xyz50 = CS_sRGB.fromRGB(srgb);
122        return this.fromCIEXYZ(xyz50);
123    }
124
125    @Override   // convert from a color in this space to sRGB (via XYZ50)
126    public float[] toRGB(float[] rgbTHIS) {
127        float[] xyz50 = this.toCIEXYZ(rgbTHIS);
128        return CS_sRGB.toRGB(xyz50);
129    }
130
131    // --------------------------------------------------------
132
133    private static final String[] ComponentNames = {"R", "G", "B"};
134
135    @Override
136    public String getName (int idx) {
137        return ComponentNames[idx];
138    }
139
140    // --------------------------------------------------

178}
